definition: Sagittarius (constellation and sign of the zodiac)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
Centaurus (constellation)

sentences.english: The star is about 10,000 light-years from Earth, in the constellation Centaurus. [Photo of the massive star.]
sentences.chinese: 該星體距離地球大約一萬光年，位於半人馬座。

sentences.english: The very noticeable Teapot of Sagittarius is below Scutum.
sentences.chinese: 人馬座顯而易見的‘茶壺’就位於它的正下方。

sentences.english: The constellations Sagittarius and Scorpius lie in this direction as well.
sentences.chinese: 人馬座和天蠍座也在這個位置。

sentences.english: The Centaur has never been used in this way before.
sentences.chinese: 半人馬座從沒有被這樣使用過。

sentences.english: Wasn't it my forefather of Sagittarius?
sentences.chinese: 難道是我人馬座的祖先嗎？

definition: Bond (Chinese constellation)

solar wind

glib of tongue (idiom)/eloquent
the intersection of the Moon's orbit with the ecliptic in Vedic astronomy (Sanskrit rahu)
to curl up/to wind around
harmonic (wave with frequency an integer multiple of the fundamental)
pentagon
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
